Locadia Profile |language=Dutch |website=VI.nl |accessdate=28 November 2018}} | position = [[Forward (association football)|Striker]] / [[Forward (association football)|Winger]] | currentclub = [[Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = 1998–2001 | youthclubs1 = [[:nl:VV Bargeres|VV Bargeres]] | youthyears2 = 2001–2004 | youthclubs2 = [[:nl:VV Emmen|VV Emmen]] | youthyears3 = 2004–2008 | youthclubs3 = [[:nl:FC Emmen|FC Emmen]] | youthyears4 = 2009 | youthclubs4 = [[:nl:RKSV Sarto|RKSV Sarto]] | youthyears5 = 2009–2010 | youthclubs5 = [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]] | youthyears6 = 2010–2012 | youthclubs6 = [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] | years1 = 2011– 2018 | clubs1 = [[PSV Eindhoven|PSV]] | caps1 = 127 | goals1 = 45 | years2 = 2018– | clubs2 = [[Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] | caps2 = 27 | goals2 = 3 | nationalyears1 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[Netherlands national under-17 football nationalteam3 = [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 13 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | nationalyears4 = 2012 | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national under-20 football team|Netherlands U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 3 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam5 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 7 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | club-update = 16:55, 28 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20:22, 4 September 2014 (UTC) }} '''Jürgen Leonardo Locadia''' (born 7 November 1993) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] or [[Forward (association football)|winger]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Locadia, who is of Curaçaoan descent,[http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/15198/8544289/sky-sports-scout-jurgen-locadia Sky Sports Scout – Jurgen Locadia]. [[SkySports]]. 21 May 2014. was born in [[Emmen, Netherlands|Emmen]], [[Netherlands]], and began playing football with the club [[:nl:VV Bargeres|VV Bargeres]], before being discovered by the youth team of [[FC Emmen]]. When he was offered to play for [[Willem II (football club)|Willem II]], he and his whole family settled in [[Tilburg]].{{cite web|url=http://blogs.rnw.nl/koninkrijksspelen2009/2009/07/16/jurgen-locadia-droomt-van-internationale-voetbalcarriere/|title=Jurgen Locadia droomt van internationale voetbalcarrière|first=Gijs|last=van den Heivel|publisher=Radio Nederland Wereldomroep|date=16 July 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090812082931/http://blogs.rnw.nl/koninkrijksspelen2009/2009/07/16/jurgen-locadia-droomt-van-internationale-voetbalcarriere/|archivedate=12 August 2009}} In 2010, he moved on to [[PSV Eindhoven]], and in 2012 at the age of 18 he was offered a professional contract. ===PSV Eindhoven=== [[File:Jurgen Locadia.jpg|left|thumb|160px|Locadia during his official debut match for PSV]] On 21 September 2011, Locadia made his first appearance for PSV in a [[KNVB Cup]] match against [[VVSB]]. He entered as a substitute for [[Tim Matavž]] in the 72nd minute. In the 80th minute, he scored PSV's sixth goal in the 8–0 win.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reached-third-round-with-a-08-win.htm|title=PSV reached third round with a 0–8 win|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110925050252/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reached-third-round-with-a-08-win.htm|archivedate=25 September 2011|df=dmy-all}} Locadia made his first start for PSV in the following round against [[FC Lisse]] on 27 October 2011.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Cup-round-of-16-with-30-win-over-FC-Lisse.htm|title=PSV reach KNVB Cup round of 16 with 3–0 win over FC Lisse|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111222072510/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Cup-round-of-16-with-30-win-over-FC-Lisse.htm|archivedate=22 December 2011|df=dmy-all}} At the beginning of the 2012–13 season, Locadia was handed the shirt number 19 for the first team. He made his first appearance of the season as a starter in a KNVB Cup match against [[Achilles '29]] on 27 September 2012. He scored the second goal in the 3–0 win over the [[Topklasse|third-tier team]].{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-progress-after-win-over-Achilles29.htm|title=PSV progress after win over Achilles'29|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120929030958/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-progress-after-win-over-Achilles29.htm|archivedate=29 September 2012|df=dmy-all}} On 30 September 2012, Locadia made his [[Eredivisie]] debut against [[VVV-Venlo]]. He entered the pitch in Venlo as a substitute in the 68th minute, and with only 22 minutes left in the game he managed to score three goals in the 6–0 win over VVV-Venlo.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-hit-tenman-VVVVenlo-for-six.htm|title=PSV hit ten-man VVV-Venlo for six|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121110040156/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-hit-tenman-VVVVenlo-for-six.htm|archivedate=10 November 2012|df=dmy-all}} He became the first player to score a [[hat-trick]] in his Eredivisie debut since [[Harald Berg]] scored three goals in his debut game on 10 August 1969.[http://www.vi.nl/achtergronden/speler/228569/Debutant-Locadia-in-de-voetsporen-van-ADOspits-Berg.htm Debutant Locadia in de voetsporen van ADO-spits Berg], VI.nl, 30 september 2012 A week after his debut hat-trick, Locadia was promoted to the first team and signed a new five-year contract with PSV which will keep him at the club until 2017.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/Jurgen-Locadia-signs-new-contract.htm|title=Jürgen Locadia signs new contract|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130126033121/http://www.psv.nl/News/News-page/Jurgen-Locadia-signs-new-contract.htm|archivedate=26 January 2013|df=dmy-all}} On 27 February 2013, he scored three goals in a 3–0 win over [[PEC Zwolle]] in the KNVB Cup semi-final.{{cite web|url=http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Beker-final-after-03-win-over-PEC-Zwolle.htm|title=PSV reach KNVB Beker final after 0–3 win over PEC Zwolle|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130703125153/http://psv.nl/News/News-page/PSV-reach-KNVB-Beker-final-after-03-win-over-PEC-Zwolle.htm|archivedate=3 July 2013|df=dmy-all}} Locadia began the [[2017–18 Eredivisie|2017–18]] season for PSV in good form, scoring nine goals and assisting six in 15 league games, including four goals in a 7–1 victory against [[FC Utrecht]]. He played regularly until he sustained an injury on 11 December. {{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/utrecht-vs-psv/372840|title=FC Utrecht 1–7 PSV Eindhoven|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 January 2018}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11741/11212902/brighton-closing-on-jurgen-locadia-deal-from-psv-eindhoven|title=Brighton closing on Locadia deal|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 January 2018}}. ===Brighton & Hove Albion=== On 18 January 2018, [[Premier League]] club [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] agreed a reported £15 million total fee with PSV for the transfer of Locadia, with £10 million being paid upfront along with £5 million in add-ons.{{Cite news|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15865537.Albion_closing_in_on_prolific_PSV_striker_Jurgen_Locadia/|title=Brighton and Hove Albion close in on Jurgen Locadia from PSV Eindhoven|publisher=The Argus|author=Andy Naylor|date=18 January 2018}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-5286295/Brighton-close-14m-deal-PSVs-Jurgen-Locadia.html|title=PSV Eindhoven forward Jurgen Locadia set for Brighton medical ahead of proposed £14million switch|publisher=Daily Mail|author=Sami Mokbel|date=18 January 2018}} He signed a four-and-a-half-year contract with ''the'' ''Seagulls'' the next day, and wears the number 25 shirt.{{Cite news|url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/january/albion-break-transfer-record-for-striker/|title=Albion break transfer record for striker|publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion Football Club|date=19 January 2018}} He reunites with former PSV teammate [[Davy Pröpper]], who joined Brighton in the 2017 summer transfer window. On 17 February 2018, Locadia scored on his Brighton debut in a 3–1 FA Cup fifth round win against [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]].{{cite web|title=Jürgen Locadia scores on debut in Brighton stroll against Coventry |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/feb/17/brighton-coventry-city-fa-cup-match-report|date=17 February 2018|accessdate=17 February 2017|publisher=[[The Guardian]]}} He scored on his Premier League debut a week later on 24 February, netting from close range in the 90th minute of a 4–1 victory against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], after coming on as a second-half substitute.{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43094255|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 4–1 Swansea City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 February 2018}} ==International career== Locadia received his first call-up to the senior [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] squad in November 2015.{{cite news|title=Locadia called into Netherlands squad for first time|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/locadia-called-into-netherlands-squad-for-first-time/|accessdate=22 March 2016|publisher=football-oranje.com|date=15 November 2015}} He was called up again in March 2016 for friendlies against [[France national football team|France]] and [[England national football team|England]],{{cite news|title=Arjen Robben pulls out of Holland squad to face France and England with a thigh injury|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3497216/Arjen-Robben-pulls-Holland-squad-face-France-England-thigh-injury.html|accessdate=18 March 2016|publisher=dailymail.co.uk|date=17 March 2016}} however he had to pull out with an injury.{{cite news|title=Karsdorp called up as four pull out of Netherlands squad|url=http://www.football-oranje.com/karsdorp-called-four-pull-netherlands-squad/|accessdate=22 March 2016|publisher=football-oranje.com|date=20 March 2016}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 26 February 2019|{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/jurgen-locadia/158589/|title=Netherlands – J. Locadia – Profile with news, career statistics and history – Soccerway|website=int.soccerway.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.psv.nl/english-psv/team/player/jurgen-locadia.htm|title=Jürgen {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==Honours== '''PSV''' *[[Eredivisie]]: [[2014–15 Eredivisie|2014–15]], [[2015–16 Eredivisie|2015–16]] *[[KNVB Cup]]: [[2011–12 KNVB Cup|2011–12]] *[[Johan Cruyff Shield]]: [[2015 Johan Cruyff Shield|2015]], [[2016 Johan Cruyff Shield|2016]] ==Musical career== Locadia is also known as a singer and has cited [[Diplo]] and [[Major Lazer]] as his influences.{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/brightons-record-14m-signing-jurgen-12052817|title=Brighton’s record £14m signing Jurgen Locadia is a rapper - and has released three singles in past year|work=[[Daily Mirror]]|date=February 19, 2018|accessdate=December 12, 2018}} In June 2017, he released his debut singles, "Take Off" and "Epok". ===EPs=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of extended plays, with selected details ! scope="col" style="width:12em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:16em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''Purple Art EP''{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/purple-art-ep/1411448082|title=Purple Art EP by Locadia|work=iTunes|accessdate=December 12, 2018}} | * Released: 23 July, 2018 * Label: Yeslo Music Group * Format: [[Music download|Digital download]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of singles, showing year released and album name !
